pullRequest.body:
Given a complemented subspace `p` of a Banach space `E`, with complement `q`, there exists an idempotent `P` in the ring  `E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] E` such that `P` has range `p` and kernel `q`. Similarly `1-P` has range `q` and kernel `p`.

See Rudin, Functional Analysis, Theorem 5.16.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c19fa47b5f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20330/commits/c19fa47b5f64908af40fa2785558746e15f5055f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsIdempotentElem.ker_id_sub_eq_range_cont`
`+ IsIdempotentElem.range_id_sub_eq_ker_cont`
`+ continuous_isIdempotent_iff_linear_isIdempotent`
`+ continuous_ker_eq_linear_ker`
`+ continuous_range_eq_linear_range`
`+ idempotentOfClosedCompl`
`+ is_idempotent_ofClosedCompl`
`+ ker_id_sub_eq_range`
`+ ker_id_sub_idempotentOfClosedCompl`
`+ ker_idempotentOfClosedCompl`
`+ mem_iff_invariant_ofClosedCompl`
`+ mem_iff_zero_ofClosedCompl`
`+ range_id_sub_eq_ker`
`+ range_id_sub_idempotentOfClosedCompl`
`+ range_idempotentOfClosedCompl`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Interestingly the norm of `P` came up in [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/Existence.20of.20a.20non-expanding.20linear.20projection/near/490947904) recently.
This is the composition of `Submodule.subtypeL` and `linearProjOfClosedCompl`.
The `omit` is a clue that this result (and the next) don't belong here. You should move them and generalize.
Oops, forgot to come back to fix that, sorry.

here and throughout, you want to inline `P` since the only purpose is to make the statement more readable (although I'm not sure it's worth it in this PR since `P` only appears once in each statement).
```suggestion
    letI P := idempotentOfClosedCompl p q h hp hq
```
I found it made the statements more readable - but on reflection I should use comments for that.
This would also work for `P : E ‚Üí‚Çó[ùïú] E` but would then need some way of inferring "P idempotent in `E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] E` implies P idempotent in `E ‚Üí‚Çó[ùïú] E`".
One more way to write this subspace: `LinearMap.eqLocus P 1`.

> This would also work for `P : E ‚Üí‚Çó[ùïú] E` but would then need some way of inferring "P idempotent in `E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] E` implies P idempotent in `E ‚Üí‚Çó[ùïú] E`".

It's just `ContinuousLinearMap.coe_injective h`.
@urkud I've put something together which works, but I doubt it's what you had in mind.

pullRequest.title: feature(Analysis/Normed/Module/Complemented): The idempotent associated with a complemented subspace
